titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 160) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the excise tax on medical devices, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1190) to repeal the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act providing for the Independent Payment Advisory Board.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-157, by Mr. Burgess.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 160 and H.R. 1190. Each bill is closed under the rule, and shall be debatable for 1 hour. The resolution also provides for one motion to recommit with or without instructions for both bills.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 42.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 319.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 319, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 319 until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 186 (Roll no. 371).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 186 (Roll no. 372).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/16/2015--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 160) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the excise tax on medical devices, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1190) to repeal the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act providing for the Independent Payment Advisory Board.
